title: 112_hr4090
content: The "Dam Safety Act of 2011" aims to enhance national dam safety by bringing together Federal and non-Federal resources to reduce risks from dam failure in the United States. The "Dam Safety Act of 2011" enhances national dam safety by amending the National Dam Safety Program Act to replace "Director" with "Administrator", expand inspection criteria to include emergency operations, and develop a public awareness program for dam safety hazards. The "Dam Safety Act of 2011" amends the National Dam Safety Program Act to include representatives from nongovernmental organizations on the Board and authorizes appropriations of $7.1 million for each fiscal year from 2012 to 2015. The Dam Safety Act of 2011 amends the National Dam Safety Program Act by changing the funding requirements for state dam safety programs and the national dam inventory for fiscal years starting in 2013. The Dam Safety Act of 2011 amends funding requirements for state dam safety programs and the national dam inventory. It authorizes $550,000 for each fiscal year from 2012 to 2015 for public awareness and $600,000 for each fiscal year from 2012 to 2015 for research. The Dam Safety Act of 2011 adjusts funding amounts for dam safety training and staff for fiscal years 2012 through 2015. The funding for training is set at $750,000 annually, while the funding for staff is set at $800,000 annually during the specified years.
